snippet: The Whistle, a new media company aimed at 6-to 16-year-olds, is forgoing a cable network beginning, instead trying to capitalize on outlets like YouTube and gaming consoles.
abstract: The Whistle, sports media company aimed at children and teens, is forgoing a presence on cable television and instead trying to capitalize on Web-based outlets like YouTube and gaming consoles that are popular among its demographic; its goal is to become ESPN for kids.
lead_paragraph: The Whistle, a new media company aimed at 6-to 16-year-olds, is forgoing a cable network beginning, instead trying to capitalize on outlets like YouTube and gaming consoles.

headline.seo: The Whistle Hopes to Be Sports Media Destination for Children
headline.main: Marketing to Young Fans on Their Technology Level
headline.print_headline: Marketing to Young Fans by Playing to Their Technology Level
